channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A new report says Trump’s ballroom will ruin the White House, but he can build it anyway
item.description: President Donald Trump’s plans to add a ballroom to the White House would be bad for the design of the White House complex and grounds, according to a...

item.title: How Your Loneliness May May Be Harming Your Whole Company
item.description: Managerial roles set people apart from their subordinates, but our always-on office culture may make leaders even more isolated.

item.title: ‘This is a wacky number’: economists cry foul as new government data assumes zero housing inflation in surprising November drop
item.description: The culprit, several economists say, is the extended government shutdown.

item.title: As data center backlash grows across the country, Change.org sees a surge of petitions in 2025
item.description: The rapid growth of data centers during the AI boom has been a dominating narrative of 2025—and, in many instances, not a popular one. Across the coun...

item.title: The AI efficiency illusion: why cutting 1.1 million jobs will stifle, not scale, your strategy
item.description: The canary in the coal mine for the broader economy is the crisis facing Black women.

item.title: A lifeline in real time
item.description: In the heart of Aceh province in northwestern Sumatra, the Ketiara Cooperative, led by the remarkable Ibu Rahmah, is facing a crisis unfolding as we s...

item.title: Lovable hits $6.6 billion valuation as its CEO says it wants to be ‘the last piece of software’ companies ever buy
item.description: The Swedish startup raised $330 million as enterprises race to adopt AI-built software.

item.title: Sam Altman’s Cringe AI Thirst Trap Says a Lot About the Future of OpenAI
item.description: The ChatGPT-maker admitted to moving resources from R&D to generate more AI slop.

item.title: Can eating cheese lower your dementia risk? A new study says maybe
item.description: Don’t beat yourself up if you do some serious damage on a cheese plate during holiday festivities this year: You just may do your future self a favor....

item.title: How Salient, an AI loan processing startup valued at $500 million, grew ARR to $25 million in two years
item.description: Salient cofounder Ari Malik built AI to automate loan servicing, turning collections calls into a high-growth business now valued around $500 million.

item.title: BTC price update: Bitcoin, crypto market could plummet again on ‘Witching Friday.’ Here’s why
item.description: Bitcoin investors are bracing for “Witching Friday” tomorrow, December 18, when billions of options are due to expire—making for what could be a highl...

item.title: Why Small Businesses Must Go Narrow (Extremely Narrow) to Survive
item.description: The path to success runs through radical specialization.

item.title: CEO of nuclear fusion firm Trump Media is merging with: High-velocity capital is critical to build quickly and efficiently. The concerns are secondary
item.description: The so-called merger of equals would make TAE Technologies the first publicly traded fusion energy developer.

item.title: New Study Tries to Settle Debate: Is Uber or Lyft Cheaper?
item.description: Researchers reveal a key money-saving tactic.

item.title: The Big Fail: Most Bomb This Post-Pandemic Work Etiquette Quiz
item.description: A recent quiz in on how to handle various office scenarios got results that would alarm Emily Post.
